div.head: To the Reader.
div.p:
COurteous Reader, J have after so many pamphlets in this kinde adventured this also into your hands; hoping that it will finde as courteous acceptance from you as the rest. Jf J love not my young Ape too well, J thinke the value of it as great as any of the same species that went before
it: which if you like as J doe, embrace it. If not laugh at it, and so too I shall not misse my end I have restrained my selfe from all Iests in earnest on any mans person which if any (unwitting to me) shall apply to him selfe, let him conceale himselfe as I doe, and he shal be the lesse laught at. A also from all scurrilous and obscene Jests which would oppose good manners or civill urbanity
Which if any expect let him desist from reading this, where J hope is nothing without the bounds of lawfull mirth. Reade on, judge, and say you the rest.
